abstract: Cheap stocks and robust consumption by its middle class are reason to buy into China now, even though markets have turned cautious on the world’s No.3 economy, a fund manager at BlackRock told Reuters.
snippet: Cheap stocks and robust consumption by its middle class are reason to buy into China now, even though markets have turned cautious on the world’s No.3 economy, a fund manager at BlackRock told Reuters.
lead_paragraph: Cheap stocks and robust consumption by its middle class are reason to buy into China now, even though markets have turned cautious on the nation, a fund manager at BlackRock told Reuters.

headline.main: China Remains Good Buy, BlackRock Says
